verb.description: Speak very softly using one's breath without one's vocal cords, especially for the sake of privacy.
examples: Alison was whispering in his ear
he managed to whisper a faint goodbye

noun.description: A soft or confidential tone of voice; a whispered word or phrase.

origin: Old English hwisprian, of Germanic origin; related to German wispeln, from the imitative base of whistle.
